Art. 4.221
Liberation with charge after a gift without charge 
If a child, brother or sister to whom property has been given by gift without charge of conservation, accepts a new liberality made by gift or will, subject to the condition that the property previously given is subject to that charge, they are no longer permitted to divide the two dispositions made in their favour, and to renounce the second in favour of the first, even if they offer to return the property included in the second disposition.
